thread.title: 'The Walking Dead' hosts huge premiere for fans in New York
thread.title_full: 'The Walking Dead' hosts huge premiere for fans in New York

author: ALICIA RANCILIO
title: 'The Walking Dead' hosts huge premiere for fans in New York
text:
Charles Sykes 'The Walking Dead' hosts huge premiere for fans in New York 
Andrew Lincoln, from left, Chandler Riggs and Steven Yeun attend AMC's "The Walking Dead" season six premiere fan event at Madison Square Garden on Friday, Oct. 9, 2015, in New York. (Photo by Charles Sykes/Invision/AP) Charles Sykes 'The Walking Dead' hosts huge premiere for fans in New York 
Christian Serratos, left, and Michael Cudlitz attend AMC's "The Walking Dead" season six premiere fan event at Madison Square Garden on Friday, Oct. 9, 2015, in New York. (Photo by Charles Sykes/Invision/AP) Charles Sykes 'The Walking Dead' hosts huge premiere for fans in New York 
Andrew Lincoln, left, and Danai Gurira attend AMC's "The Walking Dead" season six premiere fan event at Madison Square Garden on Friday, Oct. 9, 2015, in New York. (Photo by Charles Sykes/Invision/AP) Charles Sykes 'The Walking Dead' hosts huge premiere for fans in New York 
Danai Gurira attends AMC's "The Walking Dead" season six premiere fan event at Madison Square Garden on Friday, Oct. 9, 2015, in New York. (Photo by Charles Sykes/Invision/AP) Charles Sykes 'The Walking Dead' hosts huge premiere for fans in New York 
Lauren Cohan attends AMC's "The Walking Dead" season six premiere fan event at Madison Square Garden on Friday, Oct. 9, 2015, in New York. (Photo by Charles Sykes/Invision/AP) Posted: Friday, October 9, 2015 11:06 pm 'The Walking Dead' hosts huge premiere for fans in New York Associated Press | 
NEW YORK (AP) â€” A premiere Friday for season six of AMC's "The Walking Dead" at New York's Madison Square Garden was so big and orchestrated, its stars attended a rehearsal that afternoon to prepare. 
The event, which awarded fans with tickets via giveaways and sweepstakes, screened the season six premiere and then held a panel with 18 cast members. 
The red carpet itself was moved inside at the last minute due to rain and wind. But that didn't keep away the fans, many who dressed as zombies, or "walkers," as they're called on the series. 
"The Walking Dead" is about people trying to survive in a zombie apocalypse. 
It premieres Sunday at 9 p.m. Eastern. 
___
